terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A system that stores all organizational documents in a single, accessible location to eliminate redundancy and simplify document retrieval
A security feature that grants or restricts user access to specific documents or features based on their job role or responsibilities
Digital environments that allow multiple users to work together on documents in real-time, sharing edits and feedback simultaneously
Safety Data Sheets - standardized documents that provide detailed information about chemical substances, including hazards, handling, and safety measures
Regulatory Affairs Specialist - a professional responsible for ensuring products and processes comply with government regulations and industry standards
A central storage location where documents, data, or code are organized and maintained for easy access and management
The process of connecting different software systems or platforms to work together and share data seamlessly
The state of having all necessary documentation organized and easily accessible for regulatory inspections or compliance reviews
A method of organizing documents by assigning descriptive keywords or labels to make them easier to search and categorize
The ability for multiple users to edit and update documents simultaneously, with changes visible to all participants instantly
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory requirements and industry standards
Comprehensive documentation packages that contain all technical information required to demonstrate product compliance with regulations
